title: Wapfika
author: Wapfika
created_time: June 26, 2023, 01:43:29 PMLast edit: June 26, 2023, 04:37:58 PM by Wapfika
content: Here I am again asking another issue with the forum captcha using Safari mobile browser. I already clear cache and all the data on my browser but still show same result. I tested it on incognito mode and it works perfectly. The only problem persist on normal.Anyone have experience on solving this? Appreciate the help.EDIT:This solved my probler for future refence to anyone who will encounter same issue.Quote from: Lucius on June 26, 2023, 02:59:39 PMI dug a little and it seems that there are many people with a similar problem - a possible solution -> Quote from: https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/sign-captcha-challenges-iphone-iph4f43a30c9/iosSome website and app sign-in screens require you to pass CAPTCHA challenges, such as recognizing letters in unusual shapes. iCloud allows you to bypass many challenges by automatically and privately verifying your iPhone and account. You can turn this bypass on or off.Go to Settings  > [your name] > Password & Security, then turn Automatic Verification on or off.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: From I have read you can bypass captcha by logging into your account with this link (sorry, after you have looged into you account), I haven't tried ir cos I usually don't have issue with the captcha when I sign in. https://bitcointalk.org/captcha_code.phpNote; it generate a unique link just for your account.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: It is possible that the problem is in the IP address you use, i.e. that someone from that IP address was doing something malicious and now Google is looking for multiple verifications in the form of solving reCaptcha. If you use home Wi-Fi try to restart the modem and get a new IP address, and if you use mobile internet simply disconnect from mobile data and try again.There is also an alternative in the form of a special link that you can get on the login page, and with it you can avoid reCaptcha completely every time you log in.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: It could be a problem with your internet service provider, perhaps internet speed is slightly slow. Have you tried other ISPs or WiFi hotspots? Have you tried logging in using alternative browsers other than Safari browser?Are you by any chance using a VPN service?Also make sure you keep your account logged in to avoid the hustle

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Likely you internet is slow, but if not slow, try VPN and use USA or UK or other location that do not give you captca problem to see if there is any difference. If that does not work, follow the Cantsay link to bypass captcha, or if you want to login, you will see the link below the login to click on to bypass the captcha which is also the link.Quote from: Cantsay on June 26, 2023, 01:48:09 PMI haven't tried ir cos I usually don't have issue with the captcha when I sign in. https://bitcointalk.org/captcha_code.phpI have tried it several times and it always work.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: @Wapfika, internet speed is definitely not a problem, but the thing is in the browser and maybe some other things that are related to the same. As for the link you can log in without a captcha, simply do not share it, and if that happens, no one will not be able to log in to your account because it will still need your name and password. The only problem is that such a link can allow someone to brute-force your password, since there is no captcha that would slow down the process.I dug a little and it seems that there are many people with a similar problem - a possible solution -> Quote from: https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/sign-captcha-challenges-iphone-iph4f43a30c9/iosSome website and app sign-in screens require you to pass CAPTCHA challenges, such as recognizing letters in unusual shapes. iCloud allows you to bypass many challenges by automatically and privately verifying your iPhone and account. You can turn this bypass on or off.Go to Settings  > [your name] > Password & Security, then turn Automatic Verification on or off.

Can you tell us what exactly IOS gadget you use when trying to load the captcha?Also, tell us what version of Safari browse.?And maybe you are trying to access the forum with an outdated IOS device or Safari. I search a bit and it looks like the Safari browser has some bugs related to the captcha like slow loading or captcha that doesn't load properly. So I think this is not a forum issue it's your device issue that might need to be fully reset or it needs to be upgraded to the latest version.
